header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/overload.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines macros used to facilitate overloading of macros.

macro.abstract: The macro facilitates overloading of macros on the number of arguments.

usage.param: The prefix of a set of overloaded macros.
The arguments to be passed to an overloaded macro.

macro.para:
This macro counts the number of arguments in __VA_ARGS__ and expands to an expression of the following form:
pre ## count(__VA_ARGS__)
If the number of arguments is greater than , the result is to .

The number of arguments is never zero--even in situations such as the following:
(XYZ_,)()
The above is interpreted as a single empty argument.
Unlike , is a constant-time operation at the price of a much lower limit on countable elements.
macro.listing:
#include #include
#define MACRO_1(a) -a #define MACRO_2(a, b) a - b #define MACRO_3(a, b, c) a - b - c
#if
#define MACRO(...) \ (MACRO_, __VA_ARGS__)(__VA_ARGS__) \ /**/
MACRO(1) // -1 MACRO(1, 2) // 1 - 2 MACRO(1, 2, 3) // 1 - 2 - 3
#endif

This macro uses . If are already in effect, must be used instead.
macro.listing:
#include #include
#define MACRO_1(a) a #define MACRO_2(a, b) a + b #define MACRO_3(a, b, c) a + b + c
